intro: Siphocampylus tunarensis, commonly known as the Tunarensis milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Colombia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including insects and mammals. Siphocampylus tunarensis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
